page.title: 19Wingate - Refuse Disposal
page.content: One mile North of Wingate at Thornley Station a new refuse disposal plant has been constructed. In the past, disused limestone quarries and clay pits have be gradually filled in with refuse and covered with top soil and returned to their natural state for farming and grazing. Now there are no more old quarries to use for this purpose and a new solution was needed. The buildings are of a very modern design, one being in the shape of a pyramid.( Is that modern? ). The others are large and rectangular. The plant is able to incinerate the refuse from a large area and surprisingly there is no smoke and there are no smells.
